sentence: Tracey Kay McKee, 64, entered a guilty plea to one felony count of attempted illegal voting for signing and casting her recently deceased mother's early ballot in the 2020 general election, Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich reported.
author: Julie Luchetta
title: Scottsdale woman pleads guilty to casting dead mother's ballot in 2020 election

sentence: DESPITE DEMOCRACY FEARS, MORE AMERICANS ACCEPT BIDEN'S ELECTION THAN THEY DID TRUMP'S FOUR YEARS AGO "Appearing before Judge Margaret LaBianca in Maricopa County Superior Court on January 26, 2022, McKee admitted signing Mary Arendt’s name to an early ballot envelope and mailing it to Maricopa County on or between October 7, 2020, and November 3, 2020," the office of Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich said in a statement, according to the report.
author: Lawrence Richard
title: Arizona woman pleads guilty to voter fraud after accused of forging dead mother's signature

sentence: A woman from Cochise County was indicted for allegedly casting the early ballot of her dead mother during the 2020 election, Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich announced on Wednesday.

title: Weekend wrap-up: Here are the biggest Arizona stories from Feb. 4-6

sentence: The Arizona Supreme Court issued Dixon's execution warrant earlier this month at the request of Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich.
